alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued December 21 at 11:57AM PST until December 24 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM LATE THURSDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves due to elevated surf of 3 to 6 feet expected. Minor tidal overflow is possible around the time of morning high tide. * WHERE...Greatest impacts are expected on the west facing beaches of Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...From late Thursday night through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk of ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Waves can wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats nearshore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Morning high tides of over 7 feet are forecast for Friday and Saturday between 8 and 9 am local time.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to hazardous swimming conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
